intro: Brunellia elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic sycamore, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves that are often pubescent on the underside. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It typically grows in moist, fertile soils and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
